support_summary: CHEK1 (Chk1) physically binds ATXN3 which regulates its stability (Co-IP evidence)

functions.cellular_process: Maintenance of genome integrity via DNA damage-induced cell cycle arrest.
functions.effect_description: ATXN3 deubiquitinates and stabilizes Chk1, preventing its proteasomal degradation and ensuring sufficient Chk1 levels for checkpoint signaling.
biological_consequence: DNA Damage/Replication Stress → ATXN3 binds Chk1 → Removes K48-linked polyubiquitin chains → Inhibits proteasomal degradation → Increases Chk1 protein half-life → Chk1 phosphorylates Cdc25C at Ser216 → Inhibition of Cdk1/Cyclin B → G2/M cell cycle arrest.
specific_effects: Increases Chk1 protein half-life from ~2 hours to >6 hours
Antagonizes FBXO6/CUL1-mediated K48-linked ubiquitination of Chk1
ATXN3 deficiency results in compromised G2/M arrest following ionizing radiation

evidence.paper_title: Ataxin-3 promotes genome integrity by stabilizing Chk1
evidence.relevant_quote: ATX3 interacts with Chk1 and promotes Chk1 stability by antagonizing DDB1/CUL4A- and FBXO6-mediated polyubiquitination and degradation of Chk1, thus facilitating DNA repair, checkpoint signaling and cell survival when cells are attacked by genotoxic or replicative stress.

mechanism_correction: ATXN3 acts as a specific deubiquitinase (DUB) for Chk1. It does not transcriptionally regulate Chk1 but post-translationally stabilizes it by removing K48-linked polyubiquitin chains, thereby antagonizing the E3 ligases DDB1/CUL4A and FBXO6/CUL1. This stabilization is critical for the G2/M DNA damage checkpoint.
mechanism: Maintenance of genome integrity via DNA damage-induced cell cycle arrest.
effect: ATXN3 deubiquitinates and stabilizes Chk1, preventing its proteasomal degradation and ensuring sufficient Chk1 levels for checkpoint signaling.
summary: ATXN3 activates CHEK1 to modulate chk1 stabilization & g2/m checkpoint control, ultimately affecting g2/m cell cycle arrest.
